info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 22 at 6:39PM EDT by NWS Detroit
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Wayne and southwestern Macomb Counties through 715 PM EDT... At 638 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Belle Isle, or over Downtown Detroit, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could damage unsecured objects. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Grosse Pointe around 650 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Highland Park, Melvindale, Eastpointe, Northeast Detroit, Northwest Detroit, Harper Woods, Grosse Pointe Shores, Center Line, Southwest Detroit and Hamtramck. People attending Comerica Park, and the Aretha Franklin Amphitheater should seek safe shelter immediately! MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
